author: snqm
body:
I've been maintaining my dashboard of selected financials as the most recent quarterly reporting has been rolling in. I've also been keeping ratio data with recent price action.

For anyone who's still thinking in terms of valuation metrics (admittedly difficult), it's good to know how much the landscape has changed in the last few weeks and where your names are at relative to today's share prices. I intend to continue to update this data as we continue to get earnings releases through April.

Dashboards: [https://public.tableau.com/profile/weedstocks.vizzes#!/vizhome/USCACannabis-SelectedFinancials/NorthAmericanCannabis](https://public.tableau.com/profile/weedstocks.vizzes#!/vizhome/USCACannabis-SelectedFinancials/NorthAmericanCannabis)

If you hate the dashboards but could use the data:

[https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Q0Ya\_SSbHEMYsecQJVm7Pm\_R9-1mCmEKzPI8VrmaYcE/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Q0Ya_SSbHEMYsecQJVm7Pm_R9-1mCmEKzPI8VrmaYcE/edit?usp=sharing)

Covered names:

* CAD Reporting  

   * ACB, APHA, CRON, FIRE, HEXO, LABS, LHS, META, OGI, SNDL, TER, TGIF, TGOD, VLNS
* USD Reporting  

   * ACRG, AYR, CCHW, CL, CURA, CVSI, CWEB, CXXI, GGB, GNLN, IAN, IIPR, KSHB, MMEN, PLTH, TILT, TLRY, TRUL, VFF, VREO

dyodd and take care, all.

author: AloneTombstone
body:
>"We" mean unhealthy and Elderly though.

From the article

>Nederlandse artsen zijn ook geïnformeerd over patiënten uit het Italiaanse Lombardije, die gegevens bevestigen dat er ook jonge en relatief gezonde mensen getroffen worden door het coronavirus.  ,,De jongste geïntubeerde Covid-19 patiënt is een meisje van 16 jaar. Twee kinderen met Covid-19 werden ter observatie op de kinderIC opgenomen maar hadden geen aanvullende therapie nodig’’, zo staat in de informatie die is verspreid onder de Nederlandse medici. De eerste patiënt in die Italiaanse regio die werd beademd lag achttien dagen aan de ventilatie, terwijl hij relatief gezond was. ,,Het betrof een 38-jarige, verder goed gezonde man, die hiervoor marathons liep.’’

Google Translate:

>Dutch doctors have also been informed about patients from Lombardy, Italy, who confirm data that young and relatively healthy people are also affected by the corona virus. ,, The youngest intubated Covid-19 patient is a girl of 16 years old. Two children with Covid-19 were admitted to the pediatric IC for observation but did not require additional therapy, "the information circulated among Dutch physicians states. The first patient in that Italian region to receive a ventilator was ventilated for eighteen days, while he was relatively healthy. "It was a 38-year-old, otherwise very healthy man, who ran marathons for this."

author: trilogee
body:
Entire thread about about Canopy and Aphria...wtf? Let's put things in perspective here. This is David Klein, not Bruce. Constellation is effectively loaning 80M to TER with an exceptionally attractive interest rate.  

This is a huge testament to TERs management, execution and prospects. 

While 95% of other names are struggling to get cash and have little runway left TER has just landed multi-year funding to secure their operations and ensure they can whether the storm with the full support of Constellation and Canopy. That's the news here. Not about Aphria or Canopy's prospects.

author: wegwerf874
body:
A list for all current companies in the MDAX:

[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MDAX](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MDAX)

You can find your fav ETFs for MDAX and SDAX by a quick search. Note that there aren't many of them and that they are still relatively expensive (e.g. TER 0.2%, and 0.4% for the latter).

Small-cap single stocks, I don't recommend any, because I don't consider myself a good stock picker and already burnt my fingers with promising small caps. The other one I bought years ago has had a terrific run. Lab/Pharma company which reinvented itself successfully after more than 100 years. Unfortunately, I was a student back then and had neither more than a few hundred bucks to invest, nor any sophisticated knowledge of business. But hey, some luck and lots of intuition (or the other way around) - it's still a gem in my portfolio.

I don't know how real estate will perform in the future, tbh. This sector had an incredible run in the past and led to the ascend of large-cap realtors like Vonovia. When it comes to tech, I'd consider B2B businesses. Let's face it, boring, dull, heavily-regulated businesses which no one other wants to do are our secret super-power. There might still some growth in SAP. Or payment services, like other posters here have already mentioned. Netherland-based Adyen is quite expensive though, and Wirecard's secrecy does not inspire tons of trust, unfounded or not. I think there could be exciting developments happening in Europe, as soon the barriers (legally and culturally) for cross-border services are teared down. A multi-lingual service economy already works well in Switzerland, for example.

author: mfairview
body:
The document instructs Cronos employees to preserve records related to specific transactions, negotiations and other dealings with MediPharm Labs Corp. LABS, +4.60%, a Canadian extraction business; TerrAscend Corp. TER, -3.50%, which operates dispensaries in California and elsewhere; and Canadian licensed producers Heritage Cannabis Holdings Corp. CANN, +4.16% and 48North Cannabis Corp. NRTH, -29.03%, along with subsidiaries of the companies.

That's a lot of companies that do business with other companies. Some sort of witch hunt a foot?

author: auto_headshot
body:
Dozens of journalists are continuing to see patient lines forming outside of hospitals in Wuhan and other provinces, so assuming China is still testing for the virus, we should be seeing positive cases reported. No one is arguing that China’s drastic measures were a mistake early on, but failing to remember that the CCP smoothes out numbers is just plain old shying away from the truth.  

That said, Korea and Taiwan borrowed from China’s strategy and are fairing better, evidenced by their flat(ter) curve.
